title: Drawing, 1882–83
medium: Charcoal, white chalk on cream wove paper, lined
markings: Recto: Stamped in brown ink, at lower left corner: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]
inscribed: Recto: black chalk, lower left corner:   The Life Line  /  First Sketch
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: A firefighter facing right and holds an unconscious young girl in a gurney as he carries her to safety.  The girl's head rolls back, her right arm hangs down limply and the clutches a rope.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1882–83.
1882–83. Charcoal, white chalk on cream wove paper, lined. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-34.
